title.rendered: Minecraft: is the game suitable for children?

content.rendered:
Lots of kids play Minecraft. Parents often wonder at what age this popular online game from Mojang is suitable. We clarify and also give tips on how to avoid unpleasant and expensive surprises.

At what age should kids start playing Minecraft?

Depending on the provider, different age recommendations for Minecraft are shown. Anyone who downloads the app from Apple’s App Store sees the recommendation from the age of nine. Android users, on the other hand, are advised that Minecraft is suitable for children aged six and over. That’s behind it:

  • The German institution “Unterhaltungssoftware Selbstkontrolle” has officially released Minecraft from the age of six. This yellow and black USK seal can be found on many Minecraft games for consoles.
  • The providers of Minecraft for the PC, the X-Box and Nintendo Switch have decided to follow this recommendation and are showing the USK recommendation on their packaging from the age of six.
  • The USK examines games according to the criteria of youth protection and criminal law. There is no pedagogical examination. Particularly sensitive children can therefore react sensitively to some scenes. There are also ways of playing and strategies that often overwhelm young children in particular.
  • The fact that there are such scenes in Minecraft is also shared by international control bodies. This is how the American authority ESRB rated Minecraft with the recommended age from 10 years. The description states, among other things, that players can perform violent acts in Minecraft such as fending off, injuring and burning creatures.
  • Minecraft is therefore officially approved in Germany according to USK from the age of six. However, parents are the best judges of whether their child is actually suitable for this game, the scenes and strategies. The tips in the next section will help.

Tips for a successful Minecraft game with children

Hundreds of millions of users play Minecraft worldwide. Among them are many children. Above all, the colorful stone worlds and the creative construction methods exert a great fascination. So that the online game is also fun for younger children and not scary, parents can follow these instructions:

  • First, parents should try Minecraft for themselves. In this way they familiarize themselves with the world, which consists of different blocks. With this wealth of experience, they can assess whether the game is suitable for their children. Because they know their offspring best.
  • Choose the right game modes in Minecraft. The most useful for children is the creative mode. Here the player has unlimited resources, can build and design worlds immediately. Unlike other modes, the player will not be injured or damaged here either.
  • This creativity paired with visualization and a first understanding of programming also makes Minecraft didactically interesting. Schools have their own Minecraft Education Edition, which can be used in history, mathematics or computer science, for example.
  • On the other hand, in Survival and Adventure modes, there may be fights or attacks. In addition, the player must also consume virtual food here to satisfy his hunger. There is a day and night cycle, with monsters appearing at night.
  • Protect your passwords. This is how you prevent in-app purchases, which can quickly become expensive. Players can buy so-called Minecoins for money. This in-game currency is for purchase. for example of appearance, equipment and game worlds. Talk to your child and agree on clear rules here.
  • Minecraft can also be used cooperatively. In this way, several children can play together online and create worlds together. Playing, exploring and creating together is encouraged, especially in creative mode.
